danish_publication: I Kristen Madsens gård i Vejlby har nissebuk al tid haft sit tilhold. Når drengene ikke trædede (drillede) ham alt for meget, var han helt omgængelig og gjorde ikke en kat fortræd. Kom manden end nok så sildig hjem fra kjøbsted, kunde han frit kaste tömmen, nis skulde nok spænde fra. Af taknemlighed gav konen ham en ny pels til vinteren, men siden spændte nis aldrig fra, og da Kristen Madsen skjændte på ham, sagde han: "Tror du og, jeg vil fli (smudse) mine ny klæder."
english_publication: In Kristen Madsen’s farm in Vejlby, nissebuk has always had his place. When the boys didn’t tease him too much, he was very accommodating and wouldn’t harm a cat. If the man came home really late from the market, he could freely toss the reins, nis would unharness the horses. Out of thanks the wife gave him a new fur for the winter, but since then nis would never unharness the horses, and when Kristen Madsen yelled at him, he said: “Do you think I want to dirty my new clothes?”
